blocks.name: ax-un
blocks.content: Axiom of Union. An axiom of Zermelo-Fraenkel set theory. It states that a set ` y ` exists that includes the union of a given set ` x ` i.e. the collection of all members of the members of ` x ` . The variant ~ axun2 states that the union itself exists. A version with the standard abbreviation for union is ~ uniex2 . A version using class notation is ~ uniex . The union of a class ~ df-uni should not be confused with the union of two classes ~ df-un . Their relationship is shown in ~ unipr . (Contributed by NM, 23-Dec-1993.)
blocks.origin:
axiom ax-un(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wex(s2, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom ax-un(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ‚ä¢ ‚àÉ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(‚àÉ(s2,(s1 ‚àà s2 ‚àß s2 ‚àà s3))‚Üí s1 ‚àà s0)))
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
}

blocks.name: zfun
blocks.content: Axiom of Union expressed with the fewest number of different variables. (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm zfun(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  |- wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
} = {
  mpbi(wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wex(hs0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))
  ax-un(s0, s1, hs0, s2)
  exbii(s0, wal(s1, wi(wex(hs0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wal(s1, wi(wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  albii(s1, wi(wex(hs0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wi(wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  imbi1i(wex(hs0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)))))
  cbvexvw(hs0, s0, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2))), wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2))))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)))
  elequ2(hs0, s0, s1)
  elequ1(hs0, s0, s2)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2))))
  diff.wa.s(s0, wcel(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(s1), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), cv(s2))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
}

blocks.name: axun2
blocks.content: A variant of the Axiom of Union ~ ax-un . For any set ` x ` , there exists a set ` y ` whose members are exactly the members of the members of ` x ` i.e. the union of ` x ` . Axiom Union of [BellMachover] p. 466. (Contributed by NM, 4-Jun-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm axun2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wex(s0, wal(s1, wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wex(s2, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
} = {
  bm1.3ii(s0, s1, wex(s2, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3)))))
  ax-un(s0, s1, s2, s3)
  diff.wex.s(s0, s2, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3))))
  diff.wa.s(s0, wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(s1), cv(s2))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(s2), cv(s3))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s3)
}

thm axun2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ‚ä¢ ‚àÉ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(s1 ‚àà s0 ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s2,(s1 ‚àà s2 ‚àß s2 ‚àà s3)))))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
} = {
  bm1.3ii(s0, s1, ‚àÉ(s2,(s1 ‚àà s2 ‚àß s2 ‚àà s3)))

blocks.name: uniex2
blocks.content: The Axiom of Union using the standard abbreviation for union. Given any set ` x ` , its union ` y ` exists. (Contributed by NM, 4-Jun-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm uniex2(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  |- wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cuni(cv(s1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  mpbir(wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cuni(cv(s1)))), wex(s0, wal(hs0, wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(cv(s1)))))))
  bm1.3ii(s0, hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(cv(s1))))
  mpbir(wex(s0, wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(cv(s1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0))))), wex(s0, wal(hs0, wi(wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0))))))
  zfun(s0, hs0, s1)
  exbii(s0, wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(cv(s1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))), wal(hs0, wi(wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))))
  albii(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(cv(s1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wi(wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0))))
  imbi1i(wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(cv(s1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  eluni(s0, cv(hs0), cv(s1))
  exbii(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cuni(cv(s1))), wal(hs0, wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(cv(s1))))))
  dfcleq(hs0, cv(s0), cuni(cv(s1)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), cuni(cv(s1)))
  diff.cuni.s(s0, cv(s1))
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.hs0.c(cv(s0))
  diff.hs0.c(cuni(cv(s1)))
}

blocks.name: uniex
blocks.content: The Axiom of Union in class notation. This says that if ` A ` is a set i.e. ` A e. _V ` (see ~ isset ), then the union of ` A ` is also a set. Same as Axiom 3 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 16. (Contributed by NM, 11-Aug-1993.)
blocks.origin:
thm uniex(class c0) {
  |- wcel(cuni(c0), universe)
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
} = {
  vtocl(hs0, c0, wcel(cuni(c0), universe), wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), universe))
  eleq1d(cuni(cv(hs0)), universe, cuni(c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  unieq(cv(hs0), c0)
  issetri(hs1, cuni(cv(hs0)))
  uniex2(hs1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cuni(c0), universe))
  diff.hs1.c(cuni(cv(hs0)))
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm uniex(class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ ‚ãÉ c0 ‚àà ùïå
  ‚ä£ c0 ‚àà ùïå
} = {
  vtocl(hs0, c0, ‚ãÉ c0 ‚àà ùïå, ‚ãÉ hs0 ‚àà ùïå)

  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(‚ãÉ c0 ‚àà ùïå)
  diff.hs1.c(‚ãÉ hs0)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
}

blocks.name: vuniex
blocks.content: The union of a setvar is a set. (Contributed by BJ, 3-May-2021.)

blocks.name: uniexg
blocks.content: The ZF Axiom of Union in class notation, in the form of a theorem instead of an inference. We use the antecedent ` A e. V ` instead of ` A e. _V ` to make the theorem more general and thus shorten some proofs; obviously the universal class constant ` _V ` is one possible substitution for class variable ` V ` . (Contributed by NM, 25-Nov-1994.)

blocks.name: unex
blocks.content: The union of two sets is a set. Corollary 5.8 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 16. (Contributed by NM, 1-Jul-1994.)

blocks.name: tpex
blocks.content: An unordered triple of classes exists. (Contributed by NM, 10-Apr-1994.)

blocks.name: unexb
blocks.content: Existence of union is equivalent to existence of its components. (Contributed by NM, 11-Jun-1998.)

  eleq1d(cun(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), universe, cun(c0, cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  uneq1(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1))
  eleq1d(cun(c0, cv(hs1)), universe, cun(c0, c1), wceq(cv(hs1), c1))

  ssun1(c0, c1)
  ssexg(c0, cun(c0, c1), universe)
  mpan(wcel(cun(c0, c1), universe), wcel(c1, universe), wss(c1, cun(c0, c1)))
  ssun2(c1, c0)
  ssexg(c1, cun(c0, c1), universe)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cun(c0, cv(hs1)), universe))
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(cun(c0, c1), universe))
}

blocks.name: abnexg
blocks.content: Sufficient condition for a class abstraction to be a proper class. The class ` F ` can be thought of as an expression in ` x ` and the abstraction appearing in the statement as the class of values ` F ` as ` x ` varies through ` A ` . Assuming the antecedents, if that class is a set, then so is the "domain" ` A ` . The converse holds without antecedent, see ~ abrexexg . Note that the second antecedent ` A. x e. A x e. F ` cannot be translated to ` A C_ F ` since ` F ` may depend on ` x ` . In applications, one may take ` F = { x } ` or ` F = ~P x ` (see ~ snnex and ~ pwnex respectively, proved from ~ abnex , which is a consequence of ~ abnexg with ` A = _V ` ). (Contributed by BJ, 2-Dec-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm abnexg(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wral(s0, c0, wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cv(s0), c1))), wi(wcel(cab(s1, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s1), c1))), c3), wcel(c0, universe)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  syl5(wral(s0, c0, wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cv(s0), c1))), wcel(cab(s1, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s1), c1))), c3), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(cuni(cab(s1, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s1), c1)))), universe))
  uniexg(cab(s1, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s1), c1))), c3)
  syld(wral(s0, c0, wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cv(s0), c1))), wcel(cuni(cab(s1, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s1), c1)))), universe), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(ciun(s0, c0, c1), universe))
  syl(wral(s0, c0, wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cv(s0), c1))), wi(wcel(cuni(cab(s1, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s1), c1)))), universe), wcel(ciun(s0, c0, c1), universe)), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, c2)))
  ralimi(s0, c0, wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(c1, c2))
  simpl(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cv(s0), c1))
  biimprd(wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(cuni(cab(s1, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s1), c1)))), universe), wcel(ciun(s0, c0, c1), universe))
  eleq1d(ciun(s0, c0, c1), universe, cuni(cab(s1, wrex(s0, c0, wceq(cv(s1), c1)))), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c1, c2)))
  dfiun2g(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2)
  3syl(wral(s0, c0, wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cv(s0), c1))), wi(wcel(ciun(s0, c0, c1), universe), wcel(c0, universe)), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wss(c0, ciun(s0, c0, c1)))
  ralimi(s0, c0, wa(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(cv(s0), c1))
  simpr(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(cv(s0), c1))
  syl5eqssr(c0, ciun(s0, c0, c1), ciun(s0, c0, csn(cv(s0))), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)))
  iunid(s0, c0)
  syl(wral(s0, c0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wss(ciun(s0, c0, csn(cv(s0))), ciun(s0, c0, c1)), wral(s0, c0, wss(csn(cv(s0)), c1)))
  ralimi(s0, c0, wcel(cv(s0), c1), wss(csn(cv(s0)), c1))
  snssi(cv(s0), c1)
  ss2iun(s0, c0, csn(cv(s0)), c1)
  ex(wss(c0, ciun(s0, c0, c1)), wcel(ciun(s0, c0, c1), universe), wcel(c0, universe))
  ssexg(c0, ciun(s0, c0, c1), universe)
}

thm abnexg(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ (‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0,(c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c1))‚Üí({ s1 | ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c0, s1 = c1)} ‚àà c3 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà ùïå))

  eleq1d(‚ãÉ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1), universe, ‚ãÉ { s1 | ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà c0, s1 = c1)}, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚àà c2))
  dfiun2g(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2)
  3syl(‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0,(c1 ‚àà c2 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c1)), (‚ãÉ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1)‚àà ùïå ‚Üí c0 ‚àà ùïå), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, s0 ‚àà c1), c0 ‚äÜ ‚ãÉ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1))

  syl5eqssr(c0, ‚ãÉ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1), ‚ãÉ(s0 ‚àà c0, { s0 }), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, s0 ‚àà c1))
  iunid(s0, c0)
  syl(‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, s0 ‚àà c1), ‚ãÉ(s0 ‚àà c0, { s0 })‚äÜ ‚ãÉ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, { s0 } ‚äÜ c1))
  ralimi(s0, c0, s0 ‚àà c1, { s0 } ‚äÜ c1)

  ssexg(c0, ‚ãÉ(s0 ‚àà c0, c1), universe)

blocks.name: abnex
blocks.content: Sufficient condition for a class abstraction to be a proper class. Lemma for ~ snnex and ~ pwnex . See the comment of ~ abnexg . (Contributed by BJ, 2-May-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm abnex(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wal(s0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c0))), wn(wcel(cab(s1, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0))), universe)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  mtoi(wal(s0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c0))), wcel(cab(s1, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0))), universe), wcel(universe, universe))
  vprc()
  syl2im(wal(s0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c0))), wcel(cab(s1, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0))), universe), wcel(universe, universe), wral(s0, universe, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c0))), wcel(cab(s1, wrex(s0, universe, wceq(cv(s1), c0))), universe))
  alral(s0, universe, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c0)))
  biimpi(wcel(cab(s1, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0))), universe), wcel(cab(s1, wrex(s0, universe, wceq(cv(s1), c0))), universe))
  eleq1i(cab(s1, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0))), universe, cab(s1, wrex(s0, universe, wceq(cv(s1), c0))))
  abbii(s1, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0)), wrex(s0, universe, wceq(cv(s1), c0)))
  bicomi(wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0)), wrex(s0, universe, wceq(cv(s1), c0)))
  rexv(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0))
  abnexg(s0, s1, universe, c0, c1, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.universe.s(s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm abnex(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (‚àÄ(s0,(c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c0))‚Üí ¬¨ { s1 | ‚àÉ(s0, s1 = c0)} ‚àà ùïå)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {

  vprc()
  syl2im(‚àÄ(s0,(c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c0)), { s1 | ‚àÉ(s0, s1 = c0)} ‚àà ùïå, ùïå ‚àà ùïå, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà ùïå,(c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c0)), { s1 | ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 = c0)} ‚àà ùïå)
  alral(s0, universe, (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c0))
  biimpi({ s1 | ‚àÉ(s0, s1 = c0)} ‚àà ùïå, { s1 | ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 = c0)} ‚àà ùïå)
  eleq1i({ s1 | ‚àÉ(s0, s1 = c0)}, universe, { s1 | ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 = c0)})
  abbii(s1, ‚àÉ(s0, s1 = c0), ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 = c0))
  bicomi(‚àÉ(s0, s1 = c0), ‚àÉ(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 = c0))
  rexv(s0, s1 = c0)

blocks.name: snnex
blocks.content: The class of all singletons is a proper class. See also ~ pwnex . (Contributed by NM, 10-Oct-2008.) (Proof shortened by Eric Schmidt, 7-Dec-2008.) (Proof shortened by BJ, 5-Dec-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm snnex(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  |- wnel(cab(s0, wex(s1, wceq(cv(s0), csn(cv(s1))))), universe)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  mpg(s1, wnel(cab(s0, wex(s1, wceq(cv(s0), csn(cv(s1))))), universe), wa(wcel(csn(cv(s1)), universe), wcel(cv(s1), csn(cv(s1)))))
  sylibr(wal(s1, wa(wcel(csn(cv(s1)), universe), wcel(cv(s1), csn(cv(s1))))), wnel(cab(s0, wex(s1, wceq(cv(s0), csn(cv(s1))))), universe), wn(wcel(cab(s0, wex(s1, wceq(cv(s0), csn(cv(s1))))), universe)))
  abnex(s1, s0, csn(cv(s1)), universe)
  df-nel(cab(s0, wex(s1, wceq(cv(s0), csn(cv(s1))))), universe)
  pm3.2i(wcel(csn(cv(s1)), universe), wcel(cv(s1), csn(cv(s1))))
  snex(cv(s1))
  vsnid(s1)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.csn.s(s0, cv(s1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
}

blocks.name: pwnex

thm pwnex(setvar s0, setvar s1) {

thm pwnex(setvar s0, setvar s1) {

blocks.name: difex2
blocks.content: If the subtrahend of a class difference exists, then the minuend exists iff the difference exists. (Contributed by NM, 12-Nov-2003.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 12-Aug-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm difex2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(cdif(c2, c0), universe)))
} = {
  impbid2(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, universe), wcel(cdif(c2, c0), universe))
  difexg(c2, universe, c0)
  expcom(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cdif(c2, c0), universe), wcel(c2, universe))
  sylancr(wa(wcel(cdif(c2, c0), universe), wcel(c0, c1)), wcel(c2, universe), wss(c2, cun(cdif(c2, c0), c0)), wcel(cun(cdif(c2, c0), c0), universe))
  sseqtri(c2, cun(cdif(c2, c0), c0), cun(c0, c2))
  ssun2(c2, c0)
  eqtr2i(cun(c0, c2), cun(cdif(c2, c0), c0), cun(c0, cdif(c2, c0)))
  uncom(cdif(c2, c0), c0)
  undif2(c0, c2)
  unexg(cdif(c2, c0), universe, c0, c1)
  ssexg(c2, cun(cdif(c2, c0), c0), universe)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm difex2(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚Üî(c2 \ c0)‚àà ùïå))
} = {
  impbid2(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà ùïå, (c2 \ c0)‚àà ùïå)
  difexg(c2, universe, c0)
  expcom(c0 ‚àà c1, (c2 \ c0)‚àà ùïå, c2 ‚àà ùïå)
  sylancr(((c2 \ c0)‚àà ùïå ‚àß c0 ‚àà c1), c2 ‚àà ùïå, c2 ‚äÜ((c2 \ c0)‚ãÉ c0), ((c2 \ c0)‚ãÉ c0)‚àà ùïå)
  sseqtri(c2, ((c2 \ c0)‚ãÉ c0), (c0 ‚ãÉ c2))

  uncom((c2 \ c0), c0)
  undif2(c0, c2)
  unexg((c2 \ c0), universe, c0, c1)
  ssexg(c2, ((c2 \ c0)‚ãÉ c0), universe)
}

blocks.name: difsnexi
blocks.content: If the difference of a class and a singleton is a set, the class itself is a set. (Contributed by AV, 15-Jan-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm difsnexi(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), universe), wcel(c0, universe))
} = {
  pm2.61i(wi(wcel(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), universe), wcel(c0, universe)), wcel(c1, c0))
  ex(wcel(c1, c0), wcel(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), universe), wcel(c0, universe))
  mpbird(wa(wcel(c1, c0), wcel(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), universe)), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(cun(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c1)), universe))
  sylancl(wa(wcel(c1, c0), wcel(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), universe)), wcel(cun(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c1)), universe), wcel(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), universe), wcel(csn(c1), universe))
  simpr(wcel(c1, c0), wcel(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), universe))
  snex(c1)
  unexg(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), universe, csn(c1), universe)
  adantr(wcel(c1, c0), wcel(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), universe), wb(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(cun(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c1)), universe)))
  eleq1d(c0, universe, cun(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c1)), wcel(c1, c0))
  eqcomd(c0, cun(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), csn(c1)), wcel(c1, c0))
  difsnid(c1, c0)
  biimpd(wn(wcel(c1, c0)), wcel(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), universe), wcel(c0, universe))
  eleq1d(cdif(c0, csn(c1)), universe, c0, wn(wcel(c1, c0)))
  difsn(c1, c0)
}

thm difsnexi(class c0, class c1) {

  sylancl((c1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß(c0 \ { c1 })‚àà ùïå), ((c0 \ { c1 })‚ãÉ { c1 })‚àà ùïå, (c0 \ { c1 })‚àà ùïå, { c1 } ‚àà ùïå)
  simpr(c1 ‚àà c0, (c0 \ { c1 })‚àà ùïå)

  unexg((c0 \ { c1 }), universe, { c1 }, universe)
  adantr(c1 ‚àà c0, (c0 \ { c1 })‚àà ùïå, (c0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Üî((c0 \ { c1 })‚ãÉ { c1 })‚àà ùïå))
  eleq1d(c0, universe, ((c0 \ { c1 })‚ãÉ { c1 }), c1 ‚àà c0)
  eqcomd(c0, ((c0 \ { c1 })‚ãÉ { c1 }), c1 ‚àà c0)
  difsnid(c1, c0)
  biimpd(¬¨ c1 ‚àà c0, (c0 \ { c1 })‚àà ùïå, c0 ‚àà ùïå)

blocks.name: uniuni
blocks.content: Expression for double union that moves union into a class builder. (Contributed by FL, 28-May-2007.)

blocks.name: uniexr
blocks.content: Converse of the Axiom of Union. Note that it does not require ~ ax-un . (Contributed by NM, 11-Nov-2003.)

blocks.name: uniexb
blocks.content: The Axiom of Union and its converse. A class is a set iff its union is a set. (Contributed by NM, 11-Nov-2003.)

blocks.name: pwexr
blocks.content: Converse of the Axiom of Power Sets. Note that it does not require ~ ax-pow . (Contributed by NM, 11-Nov-2003.)

blocks.name: pwexb
blocks.content: The Axiom of Power Sets and its converse. A class is a set iff its power class is a set. (Contributed by NM, 11-Nov-2003.)

blocks.name: elpwpwel
blocks.content: A class belongs to a double power class if and only if its union belongs to the power class. (Contributed by BJ, 22-Jan-2023.)

blocks.name: eldifpw
